title: Carl Hayden Visitor Center Temporarily Closed
description: The visitor center at Glen Canyon Dam is closed until further notice. The pipe that supplies water from the city of Page, Ariz., to the visitor center has been shut off because of a leak. Estimated repair date: Friday Nov 25.

title: Tree work in Great Meadow at Fort Mason on Monday, November 21
description: Between 8AM-1PM on Monday, November 21, a maintenance crew will remove a dead palm tree in the Great Meadow at Fort Mason. The work site and staging ground will be closed, but access to the surrounding area will not be affected.

title: Lassen Volcanic Highway Closes to Through Traffic for Winter Season.
description: The Lassen National Park Highway is closed for the winter/spring season. Access is limited to one mile from the northwest entrance to the Loomis Plaza and the southwest entrance to the Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center.

title: Temporary closure of Old Springs Trail in Marin Headlands through November 23
description: Trail Crew will be replacing dilapidated boardwalks on Old Springs Trail August 30 through mid-November. Signs will be posted at either end of Old Springs Trail and at the Tennessee Valley parking area. Please stay out of work zone & use alternate routes

title: Closed on Thanksgiving Day
description: The Fort Clatsop Visitor Center, parking area and Fort Clatsop replica at Lewis and Clark National Historical Park will be closed on Thanksgiving Day. Park trails and associated trailheads will be open.

title: Road Closures
description: East Portal Road is closed for the season. The North Rim Road to the North Rim Campground remains open at this time; however, the road to the North Rim viewpoints is closed for the season.

title: COVID-19 Response
description: Federal guidelines require masks be worn inside the Big Hole National Battlefield Visitor Center while the CDCs COVID-19 Community Level tool shows "High" in Beaverhead County, Montana. Starting 11/18/2022 we are currently in high status.

title: Closed on Thursday, November 24, 2022, Thanksgiving
description: Please be advised that St. Paul's will be closed on Thursday, November 24, 2022, in observance of Thanksgiving. Happy holiday to all.

title: Horse Stable Rd. & multi-use trail between Bingham Dr. and Military Rd. to be temporarily closed
description: Horse Stable Rd. NW is being repaved between November 21 and November 23. Persons wishing to use the multi-use trail will have to the sidewalk to the west of Oregon Ave. The community garden will only be accessible on foot at this time.

title: Face Masks Optional: Nov 18, 2022 Status Update
description: The NPS updated its masking guidance based on the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Steamtown NHS currently resides in a "LOW" COVID-19 community level area. Masks are optional indoors and on train rides.

title: Boaters: Small Craft Advisory is in effect from 9 pm on Friday, Nov. 18 until 3 am on Sat., Nov. 19.
description: The Nat. Weather Service has issued a Small Craft Advisory for coastal waters between Point Arena and Point Reyes, including Tomales Bay. Winds of 21–33 knots (24–38 mph) and/or steep waves are expected to produce hazardous wave conditions to small craft.

title: Capulin Volcano facilities and Road temporarily closed 11/18/2022
description: Due to icy and snowy conditions, Volcano Road, the Visitor Center and park store will remain closed this morning, November 18th 2022. Facilities will open at 10:30am and Volcano Road will open as soon as conditions improve today.

title: Mask Status in Park Buildings – MASKS OPTIONAL – Week of November 18 - November 25, 2022
description: The NPS has updated its mask guidance to align with the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Each Friday, the park will update the mask status for the upcoming week. This park spans 2 counties and will follow guidance for the county with higher levels.

title: Mask Status in Park Buildings – Masks OPTIONAL – Week of November 18 - November 25, 2022
description: The NPS has updated its masking guidance to align with the CDC’s new COVID-19 Community Levels tool, which helps communities decide what prevention steps to take. Each Friday, the park will update the mask status here for the upcoming week.

title: North Rim Open for Day Use Only. —Friday, November 18, 2022
description: Grand Canyon Lodge, food services, general store and North Rim Campground are closed for the winter. Travel with enough food and water for everyone in your group. NORTH RIM SCENIC ROAD to CAPE ROYAL is CLOSED FOR THE WINTER.

title: What's Closed, and What's Open This Week? —Friday, November 18, 2022
description: Coconino County is now in CDC MEDIUM Community Level — Face Masks Are Not Required indoors or on park shuttle buses. View the updated list of what's closed, and what's open this weekend. South Rim Visitor Center is open from 10 am to 4 pm.

title: Bayside Trail Closure, November 7-22
description: The Bayside Trail will be closed to the public due to construction from Monday, November 7, through Friday, November 22. Thank you for your understanding.

title: Checking Winter Road Conditions Prior to Visit
description: Heading to John Day Fossil Beds soon and want to know what the road conditions are or if winter tires/chains restrictions are enforced? Check various highway cameras across Oregon on TripCheck.com, run by Oregon Dept. of Transportation.

title: Clara Barton NHS Closed Temporarily to the Public - Effective Nov. 18, 2022, until further notice.
description: Effective November 18, 2022, Clara Barton NHS is temporarily closed due to HVAC repairs. Updates will be posted on this website or the Clara Barton National Historic Site Facebook page when this status changes.

title: Visitor Center Restrooms Closed After Operational Hours
description: Starting on November 19, all restrooms at the Harry Hampton Visitor Center will be open from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. daily. Restrooms will be closed after operational hours. Vault toilets at the Longleaf Campground are available 24/7.

title: Construction at South Entrance near Springdale
description: There is one lane open into Zion and one lane open out of Zion at the park's south entrance. Expect delays entering the park. This is to accommodate construction improving drains under the road.

title: NPS 300 Road Conditions
description: NPS 300 to Big Tubes is rutted. High-clearance is recommended and four-wheel drive may be required. Conditions may change rapidly with rain or snow. Be prepared for poor road conditions if heavy rains or snows occur.

title: Visitor Center Closed Thanksgiving Day
description: The El Malpais Visitor Center will be closed on Thursday, November 24th for Thanksgiving. The rest of the park is open to visit while the visitor center is closed.

title: Cave Tour Reservations Available
description: Advance cave tour reservations are available on recreation.gov through April 30, 2023. The reservations close at noon the day before. A majority of tickets are on recreation.gov. Reservations are the best way to ensure tickets for your group.

title: Temporary Closure at Sunrise Campground and Sterling Barrens for Brush Removal
description: Brush removal is occurring at Sunrise Campground, west of Sunrise Ferry Landing, WI S71.8, and at Sterling Barrens, Sterling Township, Polk County. Project areas will be closed to the public while work is actively occurring.

title: Park Store Closed today 11/17/22
description: Due to hazardous weather conditions the park store inside our Visitor Center is closed today. The Visitor Center and the park remains open. For the most up to date information call us at 307-467-5283x635

title: Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.
description: This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. Carry items with you on hike. Lock your vehicle and set car alarm. Recent auto break-ins at Rinconada Canyon parking lot. Report suspicious persons loitering/peeking in cars. Call 928-638-7805

title: Information Center and Boca Negra Canyon Closed on Thanksgiving Day
description: The Information Center, Administrative Offices, and Boca Negra Canyon will be closed on November 24. Rinconada Canyon, Piedras Marcadas Canyon, and the Volcanoes Day Use Area trail systems will be open to visitors for hiking on November 24.

title: Mainland Museum Now Open!!
description: The Mainland Museum is now open with extended hours for the holiday season. Come see us between 10 am - 4 pm every day. Learn about the extensive history of the island. There is no charge to enter the museum.

title: The wearing of masks inside the WNPA Park Store are required.
description: Due to the High Transmission Rate in Bernalillo County, wearing a mask inside federal buildings is required. This includes the WNPA Park Store/Gift Shop. Masks are not provided to visitors. Visitors must have and wear a mask to enter store.

title: Landscaping work around the Mansion
description: Landscaping work for building preservation will take place around Hampton mansion from 11/17-11/23/2023. Visitor services will not be affected; however, the viewshed of the mansion will be impacted.

title: Temporary Closures begin Sunday, November 20, 2022
description: Due to ongoing mechanical issues with its heating system, Steamtown NHS will temporarily close the following: Visitor Center, Theater, History Museum, and Technology Museum. The roundhouse, railyard, and grounds remain open. Holiday events WILL continue.

title: Restrooms during Temporary Closures
description: During the temporary closures of the Visitor Center, Theater, History Museum, and Technology Museum, there will be no public access to heated bathrooms or running water. Portable toilets will be available outside.

title: Oversnow Camping off-limits
description: Oversnow camping is off-limits at the Southwest Campground due to present Dixie fire hazards. Self-contained camping is still allowed in the Southwest parking area, Fees apply, No tents.

title: Highway 180 to Cedar Grove is Closed for the Season
description: Highway 180 to Cedar Grove is now closed at the Hume gate until spring 2023.

title: Busy Thanksgiving Week Expected
description: The week of Thanksgiving is one of Big Bend's busiest times. Travelers should expect ALL park campgrounds to be FULL. If you plan on visiting the area, you will need to make reservations, and/or plan for camping/lodging outside the park.

title: Big Bend is a NO Drone Zone
description: The use of drones is prohibited in Big Bend National Park. Thank you for preserving the peace and tranquility of Big Bend.

title: Thanksgiving Hours
description: The Malaquite Visitor Center will be closed on Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, November 24, 2022. The park remains open 24-hours a day.

title: Wheeler Peak Scenic Drive Closure @ Upper Lehman
description: The Wheeler Peak Scenic Drive is closed at Upper Lehman Creek Campground, about 2.5 miles up due to ice and snow. Weather is highly variable in the park. Check https://bit.ly/3F1hoQ4 for current forecasts.

title: Holiday Closure
description: The park will close from 5:00 pm Wednesday, November 23 through 6:00 am Friday, November 25 in observance of Thanksgiving. This includes the visitor center, cavern, and entrance gates on the park road (Walnut Canyon Drive/NM 7) and Rattlesnake Springs.

title: Reservations Required to Enter Carlsbad Cavern
description: RESERVATIONS REQUIRED to enter cavern and must be purchased by clicking "more" or calling 877-444-6777. No reservations available at the park. Reservations only select the entry time. Upon arrival at the visitor center, entrance tickets must be purchased.

title: Partial Closure of Citadel Trail
description: 11/14/22 - 12/31/22: The upper portion of the Citadel Trail will be closed during this time while work is being done to resurface it. The lower portion is open with access to the Nalakihu Pueblo.

title: Group Tour Reservations on November 19
description: The 10 a.m. and 11 a.m. tours on Saturday, November 19 have been reserved for groups and will not be available to the public. The 1 p.m., 2 p.m., and 3 p.m. tours, however, will be offered as scheduled.

title: Northwest end of Hyde Street Pier Closed for Construction Activity
description: To maintain public safety during the Alma Floating Dock Replacement Project, the Northwest end of Hyde Street Pier will be closed for construction activity from November 15, 2022 to December 18, 2022.

title: Backcountry vehicle route closed for the season
description: The full backcountry vehicle route is closed for the winter season. Backcountry vehicle access is now limited to the Cabin District.

title: Night Sky Program Cancelled for Friday November 18th
description: Due to impending cold temperatures, the Night Sky Program for Friday November 18th has been cancelled

title: Naval Live Oaks Youth Campground Closure
description: The Naval Live Oak Youth Campground will be closed for repairs. This site is still open for day use of hiking trails.

title: Other Closures
description: All the park's drive-in campgrounds are closed for the season. All vault toilets in the park have been shut down, except at Sand Point and Grand Sable Visitor Center parking lot. Flush toilet at Munising Falls remains open.

title: The Cave Elevator is Closed
description: Due to mechanical issues the cave elevator is closed until further notice. During this time we are unable to offer the Accessible Tour. This only affects the Accessible Tour.

title: Antietam Battlefield Visitor Center Partially Closed
description: The park is operating out of a temporary visitor center while the permanent one undergoes rehabilitation. We expect to complete the project Spring 2023. Restrooms, exhibits and the park store are open daily from 9a -5p.
